makers.displaydate: born 1954, Nuremburg, Germany; active New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Kiki Smith, born 1954, Nuremburg, Germany; active New York, NY
Printed by Douglas Volle at Universal Limited Art Editions (ULAE)
Published by Universal Limited Art Editions (ULAE)

texts.textentryhtml:
Untitled (Hair) was my first print that Universal Limited Art Editions (ULAE) published. I was told to arrive at the print shop with nothing, so I just brought myself and used my body to create, and a self-portrait of my head unfolded. I used my hair, Xerox transfers, casts of my body, and wigs to create the images on the lithography stones. It was the first print I made at ULAE, and I’ve been happy to continue working with them since 1989.

Kiki Smith
[Dolan/Maxwell, Philadelphia, PA]; purchased by James Kraft (1935-2022) in 1990; gifted to the Princeton University Art Museum, 1993.
